definition: double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
to make a profit/to earn a packet
to earn back (money one invested, wasted etc)

sentences.english: He had formerly been in business at Bristol, but failed in debt to a number of people, compounded, and went to America.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏他專心一志地做生意，在幾年中就賺到許多錢。

sentences.english: Some investors even raked in up to 40 percent in profits.
sentences.chinese: 一些投資者甚至迅速賺得高達40%的利潤。

sentences.english: Will you ever be able to make money on general-interest news on the Internet?
sentences.chinese: 你能從網上的新聞中賺到錢嗎？

sentences.english: If the self-employed person succeeds in business, he has the chance to earn a great deal of money.
sentences.chinese: 如果自僱人士的商業成功，他有機會賺很多錢。

sentences.english: Judy earned money for her college education by slinging hash in a fast-food restaurant during the summer.
sentences.chinese: 朱蒂夏季在快餐店裏端盤子賺上大學的學費。

sentences.english: So how does one earn more?
sentences.chinese: 怎麼才能賺到更多的錢？

sentences.english: How did Mary make most of her money?
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗全豹的錢是奈何賺到的？

sentences.english: Do you know how much Sally earns each month?
sentences.chinese: 你知道吳欣每個月賺多少錢嗎？

sentences.english: As you are saving your money, you are definitely making a room for more money in your life.
sentences.chinese: 當你正在攢錢，你肯定是交房時賺更多的錢。

sentences.english: They have to spend everything they earn every day.
sentences.chinese: 因此，每天孩子們只能花光當天所賺來的錢。

sentences.english: We will be making substantial profit on the first flight.
sentences.chinese: 首航我們就能賺可觀的錢。

sentences.english: Digging endless, take endless, earn several hundred thousand a year.
sentences.chinese: 挖不盡，取不完，一年能賺十幾萬。

sentences.english: Morgan:No wonder the department stores earn billions in a single day.
sentences.chinese: 難怪百貨公司可以在一天就賺進上億的鈔票。

sentences.english: If you do this, you will earn the level's cheat code.
sentences.chinese: 如果你這樣做，你就賺了水平的金手指碼。

sentences.english: Soon, Nacho and his partner are making a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 奈奇和他的搭檔很快就賺進大把鈔票。

definition: to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to make a profit/to earn a packet
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
